"We've canceled PvE only to turn around and sell whatever was 'finished' back to YOU the player for a 15 bucks! This is surely a value to YOU, the player! ;D"

 ~Kobby Botick; your current overlord.

poha de jogo estranho, na blizzart parece que ta mais otimizado

Played OW1 diligently.  Never fully understood all the bad critiques of it.

But gave OW2 a chance.  Really tried.  Came back to it on Steam after seeing a new PvE event come out.

40 dollars for the event.  FORTY DOLLARS for 3 story missions.  This game is so bad and so run down.

What a true waste of a good game on a terrible company.  At least we can truly see how bad the game is for once through reviews.  Can't wait for Your Overwatch to spin this now.

After the push to revive overwatch from mismanagement and a drought of updates, the original overwatch formula is slowly being restored. However, to promise the PvE experience of a full game to then sell small bundles of missions occasionally to recoup the work done is a disgusting approach. While the addition of a shop is fair to operate a live service game, the monetisation feels aggressive and over-costed, pricing individual skins in a way to make the battlepass feel like "good value".
I loved when Reinhardt said "MONEY DOWN" and then all my cash flew out of my wallet!

I just like to play Roadhog thats all

Overwatch 2 has squeezed every last ounce of fun I had playing this game with my friends before it changed from Overwatch 1. 

I gave Overwatch 2 a shot, I really did. I signed up for a comp team with my university and went to a LAN and competed. Didn't do terribly.

I haven't played since I was obligated to play. I probably won't again since the game is now predicated on a FOMO system of locking heros and a predatory battle pass.

A terrible game made by a company full of sexual predators and C level executives who abuse their workers.
Small indie company Blizzard ruins yet another game. Unlock the rest of the review for $15 (Ill add another 10 words each season, but that's an extra $15 each time)
